question: Determine the athlete holding the record for most Olympic gold medals considering records valid as of 2024, denoted $r$; using archival sources published strictly after $r$'s inaugural Olympic competition, identify the yacht that secured victory in both races of the 12 Metre class competition at the 1908 London Olympics.
subject: web_search
constant_ev: Consider Olympic records valid as of 2024 when determining the current record holder
derived_ev: Michael Phelps holds the all-time record for Olympic gold medals with 23 golds across five Olympic Games (2000-2016)
Larisa Latynina holds the second-highest Olympic gold medal count among women with 9 gold medals
Mark Spitz holds the second-highest Olympic gold medal count among men with 9 gold medals prior to Michael Phelps' dominance
The athlete with the most Olympic gold medals is Michael Phelps
The 12 Metre class competition at the 1908 London Olympics was held on August 11-12 and took place on the River Clyde
The British yacht Hera, owned and skippered by Thomas Glen-Coats, won the 12 Metre class competition at the 1908 London Olympics
The International 12 Metre Association, BBC Scotland's historical archives, and the official IOC report confirm Hera defeated the French yacht Mouchette in both races
The yacht that won the 12 Metre class competition at the 1908 London Olympics is Hera

tier1_result.reasoning: They agree because multiple authoritative sources confirm Michael Phelps’ Olympic record and debut and independently verify that the yacht Hera won both 1908 races. The solver’s answer "Hera" matches the expected answer and the reasoning is factually correct and based on appropriate post-2000 sources.
